page.title: 04Sunniside.
page.content: A linear village which grew up along what is now the A692 road. Stone built farm houses and cottages can still be found on the lanes leading to Gateshead and Whickham, the village centre is the result of the growth of mining in the l9th. century. Behind the main street with its two rows of shops are red brick terraces. The track bed of the Tanfield wagonway (built l725) and now a country walk is the main reminder of mining. Between the wars numbers of larger houses appeared at either end of the village but the village's present size is the result of council housing on land to the north extending towards Whickham. Most houses are 'link villas'. Many are now privately owned. Although basically a commuter village Sunniside has three garden centres.
